wikipedia_page.main: James Gray (February 18, 1862 – September 8, 1916) was a journalist and the 19th mayor of Minneapolis.

response: ** James Gray, American journalist, 19th Mayor of Minneapolis (b. 1862)
James Gray (or variants) may refer to:
* James Gray (mayor) (1862–1916), American journalist and mayor of Minneapolis, Minnesota
* James Gray (New Zealand cricketer) (1887-1975), played for Canterbury
* James Gray (footballer, born 1992), Northern Irish footballer
* Sir James Gray, 2nd Baronet (c. 1708–1773), diplomat and antiquary
* James Gray (poet) (died 1830), Scottish linguist and poet
* James Gray (mathematician) (1876–1934), Scottish mathematician and physicist
* James Gray (mayor) (1862–1916), American journalist and mayor of Minneapolis, Minnesota
* Sir James Gray, 1st Baronet (1667–1722), armiger and merchant-Burgess of Edinburgh

* The first primary election in the United States took place, as an 1899 Minnesota law was given its first trial. There were 254 candidates seeking their political party's nomination for various positions in the city of Minneapolis. In the race to be the nominee is the November general election for Mayors of Minneapolis, Mayor James Gray was the Democrat's pick, while former Mayor A. A. Ames was the Republican choice.
